description:
With a history that dates back to 1991, the Law Office of David L Hood in North Charleston, South Carolina, has served the needs of individuals and families across the state for more than 25 years. Based in Murrells Inlet, the firm has grown to include 12 total offices in South Carolina, and it has gained a reputation as one of the state's leading law firms for all types of personal injury and wrongful death claims as well as matters involving Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI).

Whether your suffering is the result of a motor vehicle accident, medical malpractice, a defective product or some other preventable tragedy, you can rely on the decades of experience of the law firm's founder, attorney David L. Hood, to help you make the best-informed decisions regarding your options.

Over the course of its history, the firm has recovered millions of dollars in total compensation for its plaintiff clients. Attorney Hood is Notable peer-review rated* through Martindale-Hubbell and has also earned the organization's Gold Client Champion award, so you can trust that you will receive the highest level of advocacy and support directly from a local attorney who has your and your family's best interests at heart.

To schedule a free initial consultation to discuss your matter and find out how the Law Office of David L Hood can best assist you in this dire time of need, you can call the office or visit the firm's website to set up an appointment. The team offers virtual consultations to help keep you and your loved ones safe in today's uncertain environment and promises to fight hard on your behalf to assert your rights and improve the likelihood that you will obtain the justice you deserve.

*AV速, AV Preeminent速, Martindale-Hubbell Distinguished and Martindale-Hubbell Notable are certification marks used under license in accordance with the Martindale-Hubbell certification procedures, standards and policies. Martindale-Hubbell速 is the facilitator of a peer-review rating process. Ratings reflect the anonymous opinions of members of the bar and the judiciary. Martindale-Hubbell速 Peer Review RatingsTM fall into two categories - legal ability and general ethical standards.
